{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2991220,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T01:56:34.941Z","cooked":"

I am trying to use PhotonVision with a Raspberry Pi 3 and a PiCam v2. It was working pretty well, but after a recent reboot the image is distorted. It looks all red, sort of like an old VGA monitor when a pin is broken.

This is what the “Normal” image looks like in the PhotonVision web UI.

Screenshot 2022-01-13 194751922×690 152 KB

To rule out a hardware problem I used raspistill to capture an image, and this is what I got. It looks correct.

pic3280×2464 1.44 MB

One thing that seems a little suspicious is that the camera is showing up named “mmal_service_16.1”. If I recall, it had “picam” somewhere in the name before the problem started.

Any ideas?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T01:56:34.941Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":183,"reads":207,"readers_count":206,"score":986.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400143,"topic_slug":"camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/9/d/9da8beea6cb3f4159f0c7ad75872019a9bc83a91.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/8/7/879e63d917164dd4932e15fa2f7af575e3767fdd.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/photon-vision-stability-and-multiple-cameras/400457/8","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Photon Vision Stability and Multiple Cameras","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision/400143/1","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2991229,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T02:03:18.798Z","cooked":"

Good check with the Raspistill - I concur, the camera hardware looks reasonably functional.

Can you screenshot the settings page? What software version does it indicate is running, and what camera hardware?

Also, if you are able to post the .zip produced by “export settings”, there are some log files we could look into.

image1850×476 47 KB

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T02:03:18.798Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":182,"readers_count":181,"score":76.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400143,"topic_slug":"camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/4/9/491f9f87c64b550057345a8bf9244134ed835200.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision/400143/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2991230,"name":"Declan","username":"pietroglyph","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pietroglyph/{size}/149915_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T02:03:54.626Z","cooked":"

Strange… It’s possible that the white balance gain is out of whack; what happens if you adjust the “Gain” slider? Another possibility is that (for some reason) the GPU acceleration has stopped working. Have you updated your Pi recently? We currently don’t support Bullseye because that version broke MMAL for us.

If you could go to settings and click “Export settings” and upload the ZIP file here then that would help a lot too. A screenshot of the settings page @gerthworm asked for would be great too.

Here is a screenshot of the settings page:

image1660×421 40.3 KB

See attached ZIP for a settings export. photonvision-settings.zip (23.0 KB)

I did have Bullseye on this Pi, but I am running the PhotonVision image now.

Zero gain*:

image869×646 42.2 KB

100 gain*:

image874×638 40.4 KB

  • The camera is physically upside down. I flipped the images in the OP.

Maybe related, but maybe not… Why is the image cropped so much? Notice how much more visibility there is in the shot from raspistill.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T02:34:56.942Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":37.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400143,"topic_slug":"camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision/400143/5","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2991268,"name":"Declan","username":"pietroglyph","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pietroglyph/{size}/149915_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T02:47:14.790Z","cooked":"

The image is cropped because raspistill is capturing in a different “video” mode. The different video modes have different fields of view both because of sensor binning and on-camera cropping. I’ll take a look at your logs in a bit.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T02:47:36.257Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":37.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400143,"topic_slug":"camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision","display_username":"Declan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29132,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision/400143/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2991286,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T03:20:06.701Z","cooked":"

I talked a bit with Matt - the gain slider was previously not hooked to the expected camera parameters. Once it got hooked up correctly (fairly recently), the behavior changed.

Current behavior limits exposure time based on the framerate. Choosing a higher resolution in the UI should reduce the framerate, which will help get the higher exposure back (based on your pipeline names, sounds like you’re looking to detect cargo?). An upcoming release should add the ability to reduce framerate at lower resolutions too.

In general, I try to keep the brightness slider at or near 50%, that should prevent some of the grey haze you’re seeing in the images.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T03:20:06.701Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":41.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":400143,"topic_slug":"camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision/400143/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2991301,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T03:52:48.906Z","cooked":"

I don’t think that’s it. When I use Driver Mode I’m getting >100 fps but the image is still not working. I have the resolution at the lowest possible value.

image3224×1640 178 KB

I tried flashing a fresh copy of the PhotonVision Pi image and I’m still getting same results.

gerthworm:

Choosing a higher resolution in the UI should reduce the framerate, which will help get the higher exposure back

Sorry, I think I misunderstood. You wanted me to choose a higher resolution, not lower. There are three options: 320x240 (see screenshot above), 640x480 (did not improve image), and 1920x1080. At the 1920x1080 the stream froze. I tried to change it to a lower resolution but the UI did not do anything. I refreshed the browser but it would not load fully. I attached another export.

photonvision-settings (2).zip (7.9 KB)

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T04:01:07.563Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":400143,"topic_slug":"camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"/uploads/short-url/7C8QK8NUMUPIRZMXuFFt5fN2fPb.zip","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision/400143/9","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2991420,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T13:42:10.563Z","cooked":"

Sounds good, thanks.

The frozen UI I’ve seen from more than one root cause. One has been the browser itself - some PC/browser combos were not happy about having a full 1920x1080 mjpg stream thrown at them, and bog down to the point where they stop rendering.

There’s at least one stack trace in there I know I could go dig into:

[2022-01-13 22:54:15] [VisionModule - VisionModuleChangeSubscriber - mmal_service_16.1] [ERROR] Failed to invoke camera settable method: setVideoModeIndex

Additionally, I do have the symptom replicated on my end.

1920x1080 - framerate is slow enough for reasonable illumination -

image1273×1200 215 KB

320*240 - framerate too high to keep the shutter open long enough to get good illumination.

image1278×1205 282 KB

There’s two related issues that I think you’re being hit by:

  1. The gain slider probably needs to be split into two - right now it controls both red/blue balance simultaneously, and it’s been reported from multiple folks it’s hard to get a good non-retro-reflective image of a ball.
  2. The framerate needs to be cappable so the shutter time can be increased and let more light into the camera.

FWIW most of us have been testing with picam v1.3’s - not to say for sure you should switch, but just be aware of some of the image binning implications of the v2

I updated two issues to help track this:

github.com/PhotonVision/photonvision

Split Picam gain slider into individual red/blue components

opened 01:44PM - 14 Jan 22 UTC
gerth2

https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/camera-image-distorted-using-photonvision/400143/10 and https://discord.com/channels/725836368059826228/725846784131203222/931402784169934868 for discussion

github.com/PhotonVision/photonvision

Allow higher exposure on picam in driver mode

opened 10:48PM - 13 Dec 21 UTC
mcm001

This is as bright as it goes

Additionally - and this is a bit of a hack but to get you going for now… do you have a USB webcam you could try? We’ve gotten good reports from those doing colored shape detection.

FWIW I also ran in to the same thing but never traced it down, as I thought it was a fluke (I was building on a Jetson, not an x86 PC). It seems to work fine in CI at the very least, so it points to something different between CI and a “local” environment.

We’ll look in to it.
